data.text: We launched The ECB Podcast this week! Listen to @MichaelSteen discuss the benefits of new technologies as part of wider conversation on payment innovation with ECB Executive Board member Benoît Cœuré – one of our guests for this first episode #podcast https://t.co/odpESiXKTt https://t.co/0PvKKF3tTk
@Alpza15 Thanks for your interest @Alpza15. The seminar material will be made available to participants only. Here is the programme in case you're interested in joining https://t.co/7FxmOJBjrR
... and now with the correct link: https://t.co/7FxmOJBjrR https://t.co/o33hnR63OP
@MarioMoratalla Thanks for flagging @MarioMoratalla! Here is the correct link: https://t.co/7FxmOJBjrR
We wensen alle teams veel success! We verheugen ons erop de winnaars volgend jaar in Frankfurt te ontmoeten. https://t.co/1yxOgFP7a3
Are you a journalist and interested in banking supervision? Come along to our journalist seminar on 5-6 November which will focus on the banking union https://t.co/UeWtAetfJZ https://t.co/Hi8YcvEsM6
Working paper: Introducing dominant currency pricing in the ECB’s global macroeconomic model https://t.co/oFTNxMobi5

Interview Andrea Enria with the Times of Malta https://t.co/iCVHIK25AF
Onnea matkaan kaikille joukkueille. Odotamme innolla voittajajoukkueiden tapaamista Frankfurtissa ensi vuonna! https://t.co/1sI85SzCtP
¡Buena suerte a todos los equipos! ¡Esperamos conocer a los ganadores en Frankfurt el próximo año! https://t.co/xu3oyF7QnK
Bonne chance à toutes les équipes! Nous avons hâte de rencontrer les gagnants à Francfort l’année prochaine! https://t.co/8iR6gV3QN6
Viel Glück an alle Teams! Wir freuen uns darauf, die Gewinner im nächsten Jahr in Frankfurt zu treffen! https://t.co/XN61rYS3ov

Kick-start your career with a traineeship at the ECB. We welcome applications from EU nationals with at least a bachelor’s degree and no more than 12 months’ work experience since graduation https://t.co/xJ12S6WniX https://t.co/hafBreRMRP
Speech Luis de Guindos: Key vulnerabilities for euro area financial stability https://t.co/hja028L7Ou
Euro area bank interest rate statistics (Aug 2019) https://t.co/ICPHCSlpBW

President Mario Draghi calls for more supportive fiscal policy alongside monetary policy for a faster return to price stability with fewer side effects. Read the full speech https://t.co/uVn1Kzvkyz https://t.co/CNzhT1hH05
Euro area quarterly balance of payments and international investment position (Q2 2019) https://t.co/g70wV8Ffrm
The new rate will be published at 08:00 CET on each TARGET2 business day. Find out more about the €STR https://t.co/ghwZB0vgKN

The euro short-term rate (€STR), a new benchmark interest rate, has been published for the first time. The rate reflects the wholesale euro unsecured overnight borrowing costs of banks located in the euro area. The €STR is available here https://t.co/BUp2OidOjS #EuroSTR https://t.co/b14OFa6YHP
Speech Mario Draghi: Stabilisation policies in a monetary union https://t.co/uVn1Kzvkyz

Interview Philip R. Lane: Q&A with Reuters https://t.co/O50kxlnl3R
Working paper: Financial integration in Europe through the lens of composite indicators https://t.co/jjCOcVkziw
Occasional paper: Early French and German central bank charts and regulations https://t.co/ak2uFI88ky

The ECB Podcast has arrived! Crypto-assets, blockchain and Facebook’s Libra are among the topics discussed by our host @MichaelSteen and guests. Listen, subscribe and let us know what you think #podcast https://t.co/7TL9SLG3S4 https://t.co/Fvhs9QXffq
Interview Mario Draghi with Financial Times https://t.co/ehlZpuEgDs

This year’s ESRB Conference included a speech by Mario Draghi – in his role as ESRB Chair – and a panel discussion on the future of financial services. The potential implications of cybersecurity for systemic risk were discussed too. Watch the sessions https://t.co/RytVElbPty

Interested in statistics on banking supervision? Take a look at our new, easier-to-use webpage where you can find data on the composition of banks’ assets by country, their capital adequacy and more https://t.co/Eq9ZVuuCpG
Decisions taken by the Governing Council of the ECB (in addition to decisions setting interest rates) https://t.co/UKbcKRYL1n
ECB enhances reporting on FX interventions https://t.co/EEbqf4PdEo
We’re excited to launch a new ECB communications channel next week! 🎙️ Watch this space… https://t.co/uU0Rhud7jd

Coming up at 14:30 CET – ECB Chief Economist Philip R. Lane in conversation with Daniel Burns, Economics Editor at Reuters.
Follow live here https://t.co/ITNW4mAzp1 https://t.co/tNbQlhoG3A
Letter from the ECB President to Mr Domènec Ruiz Devesa, MEP, on monetary policy https://t.co/8WqU324e3u
Letter from the ECB President to Mr Sven Giegold, MEP, on institutional matters https://t.co/LaqFxSLHwP
Letter from the ECB President to Mr Matt Carthy MEP, on institutional matters https://t.co/Tbk7SR23mw
Letter ECB President to Ms Eva Kaili, MEP, on stablecoin initiatives https://t.co/OEBZmYKShw
ECB publishes the Euro money market study 2018 https://t.co/fBP7uJadBu

The average person in the eurozone made 121 card payments in 2018, up from 56 in 2008. The average value of each card payment has fallen steadily, from €54 in 2008 to €44 in 2018. Read the full article here https://t.co/wtNtVupGrI https://t.co/ndV9iJtQ1l

In 2018 card payments accounted for almost half of the total number of non-cash payments in the eurozone. Use our interactive statistics tool – available in 23 EU languages – to compare countries https://t.co/wtNtVupGrI

Andrea Enria: We should be open-minded in the conversation about the future of stress tests. They should remain serious, challenging and credible exercises and they should help supervisors to ensure the safety and soundness of banks https://t.co/tfVRT0DTNJ 3/3

Andrea Enria: We need to seriously consider disclosing Pillar 2 guidance at some point. This is particularly true in a bail-in world, where private investors and not taxpayers are supposed be first in line when it comes to picking up the bill following a crisis. 2/3 https://t.co/CjbE1VPR0B

(THREAD) It is time to rethink the design of stress tests, says Supervisory Board Chair Andrea Enria. We can rely on three yardsticks to gauge how best to proceed: realism, relevance and resources https://t.co/VY0Oi9fivj 1/3 https://t.co/EDLK0t4hnc
Speech Andrea Enria: On supervisory architecture https://t.co/FXncrtAkTG

The euro short-term rate (€STR), a new interest rate benchmark, will be published for the first time on 2 October. Our second roundtable on euro risk-free rates yesterday focused on the transition from EONIA to the €STR. Watch the sessions here https://t.co/Dn7pfk4Gb4 https://t.co/G6w7qQkhWO
@Percy_Blooms 👌
Speakers also include Supervisory Board Chair Andrea Enria as well as Sharon Donnery, Deputy Governor of the Central Bank of Ireland @centralbank_ie  https://t.co/SW4ZkNxG9G

What does cybersecurity mean for systemic risk? How will financial services evolve in the future? Watch live as Mario Draghi – in his role as ESRB Chair – speaks at the ESRB Conference where these topics and more will be discussed https://t.co/h0GvBsdDML https://t.co/6okZ9p2T3h

Today is the European Day of Languages! To celebrate, we asked some of our colleagues what languages mean to them – here is what they said.

#EDLangs #EuropeanDayofLanguages #EDoL https://t.co/MlqGlw8SMU
Working paper: Finance and carbon emissions https://t.co/kd2qY08bmC

Economic Bulletin: The slowdown in economic activity and higher oil prices weighed on profit margins in 2018, while lower oil prices drove them up in the first half of 2019
Economic Bulletin: Weaker profit margins dampened the increase in domestic price pressures in 2018 but rebounded in the first half of 2019
Economic Bulletin box: How do profits shape domestic price pressures in the euro area? https://t.co/JPaUaxZQnr
Economic Bulletin: Liquidity provided through Eurosystem’s monetary policy operations declined by €10.7 billion
Economic Bulletin: Average excess liquidity declined by €42.9 billion compared with the previous review period
Economic Bulletin box: Liquidity conditions and monetary policy operations in the period from 17 April to 30 July 2019 https://t.co/1Rg8exPdiu
Economic Bulletin: Domestic and external factors led to the drop in euro area industrial production in the past year
Economic Bulletin box: Domestic versus foreign factors behind the fall in euro area industrial production https://t.co/X0JhbGFF1r
Economic Bulletin: Understanding income risk is key to evaluating the amplification of macroeconomic shocks
Economic Bulletin: Income risk in the euro area rises in recessions and affects households unequally
Economic Bulletin box: Household income risk over the business cycle https://t.co/4BiABiZnHK
Economic Bulletin: EMIR data allow a first systematic look at activity in inflation-linked swap markets
Economic Bulletin: Learn how EMIR data can shed light on investors’ interest rate expectations
Economic Bulletin: EMIR derivatives data open up new avenues for central bank analysis

Economic Bulletin article: The taxonomy of ECB instruments available for banking supervision https://t.co/opTE2CK3RW

The annual growth rate of broad money (M3) in the euro area increased to 5.7% in August 2019 from 5.1% in July. Full press release https://t.co/B53vLUBNkq 

This is our 250th monthly update on monetary developments in the euro area! #EUROat20 https://t.co/QnPKCpCgtw
Speech Benoît Cœuré: Introductory remarks at the Committee on the Digital Agenda of the Deutscher Bundestag https://t.co/Mix7xzXLAU

Economic Bulletin: Income risk in the euro area rises in recessions and affects households unequally. Understanding income risk is key to evaluating the amplification of macroeconomic shocks https://t.co/4BiABiZnHK
Economic Bulletin box: Household income risk over the business cycle https://t.co/4BiABiZnHK
Speech Luis de Guindos: Concluding remarks at the ECB conference “Inflation in a changing economic environment” https://t.co/H2fi73rJQm
Speech Luis de Guindos: Measures to support monetary policy transmission through banks https://t.co/KRyzYfmCW4
Meanwhile, labour productivity growth and real wage growth have been relatively weak. Read our full Economic Bulletin article to find out more https://t.co/JHKKJqchjz 4/4 https://t.co/L26YnYighV
Another notable feature of the current expansion is the fast decline in the unemployment rate – by an average of 0.7 percentage points per year between 2014 and 2018. 3/4 https://t.co/ap8wlf1RF2

The current expansion is more employment-rich than previous ones, assessing employment growth against real GDP growth. This expansion’s average real GDP growth rate is the lowest observed for each expansion since 1965, but employment growth did not decelerate as much as GDP. 2/4 https://t.co/gRGbpEWnJe

(THREAD) Employment in the eurozone has grown for almost six consecutive years. Eleven million more people have been employed in the eurozone since the start of this expansion in 2014. 1/4 https://t.co/7rgXFX8dRw
You’re now one of 500,000 people following us! Thanks a (half) million! https://t.co/r66lxNGyQD
Press release: ECB sanctions Piraeus Bank S.A. for breaching own funds provisions between 2015 and 2017 https://t.co/0nZ1Dn8ijw

President Draghi is now speaking to ECON members in his capacity as Chair of the ESRB.

➡️ Introductory statement https://t.co/UDuI68Qx6B 
➡️ Press release on medium-term residential real estate sector vulnerabilities https://t.co/fhJ7L6wfwM
Draghi: Different elements of the package will be mutually reinforcing in supporting favourable financing conditions for businesses and households
Draghi: Strong monetary policy response was essential, ECB decided on a comprehensive package
Draghi: The longer weakness in manufacturing persists the greater the risk that other sectors of the economy will be affected
Draghi: Countries with large manufacturing sectors like Germany are more vulnerable to turns in the economic cycle
Draghi: Since last ECON hearing in spring euro area growth momentum has slowed markedly and more than we had anticipated
Draghi: ECB has repeatedly and clearly shown its readiness and determination to fulfil the primary objective of price stability
President Draghi speaks at a hearing before the European Parliament’s ECON committee. Introductory statement here https://t.co/LikaVIgzr5

Coming up in 15 minutes: ECB President Mario Draghi’s quarterly hearing before the European Parliament’s Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs @EP_Economics. Follow live from 15:00 https://t.co/aJlGaGeyiD https://t.co/inVBehFOsO
Economic Bulletin: EMIR data open up new avenues for central bank analysis and allow a first systematic look at activity in inflation-linked swap markets https://t.co/5EnO2HRxBL
Economic Bulletin article: Derivatives transactions data and their use in central bank analysis https://t.co/5EnO2HRxBL
Economic Bulletin: Domestic and external factors led to the drop in euro area industrial production in the past year https://t.co/X0JhbGFF1r

This week we’re at the global financial services conference @Sibos, discussing #instantpayments as a driver of innovation across Europe and previewing Europe’s new real-time gross settlement service. Follow @TARGET_ECB for the latest updates. Full agenda https://t.co/sJgv3rvQdU https://t.co/w64RcrxONg

What impact do superstar firms have on the economy? Philippe Aghion of the London School of Economics told us about his work on this topic at our Annual Research Conference. Check out our website for all the research presented at the conference https://t.co/1tTSJVOe6s https://t.co/BgtDyoWBxq

We’ll be at the global financial services conference @Sibos, next week, discussing #instantpayments as a driver of innovation in Europe and previewing Europe’s new real-time gross settlement service. Follow @TARGET_ECB for the latest updates. Full agenda https://t.co/sJgv3rvQdU https://t.co/Nj5LKA8mWW

Calling students with knowledge of data masking, machine learning, APIs or front-end development. Apply now to take part in our coding challenge, working alongside our IT and risk management experts to solve one of the challenges we’ve set for this event https://t.co/mCmx1KVjFw https://t.co/ljKI9FdfjT
Benoît Cœuré: Global central banks need to join forces and jointly investigate the feasibility of central bank digital currencies (CBDCs). Full speech here https://t.co/5qW2jvGVLZ 8/8

Benoît Cœuré: The ECB recently launched Target Instant Payment Settlement (TIPS), which allows payment service providers to offer funds transfers to customers across Europe in real time, around the clock, and on every day of the year. 7/8
